snippet: An Israeli judge ruled that a huge trove of documents written by Franz Kafka and his friend Max Brod must be turned over to Israel’s national library, which plans to publish them online.
abstract: Israeli Judge Talia Kopelman Pardo rules that huge trove of documents written by Franz Kafka and his friend Max Brod must be turned over to Israel’s national library, which plans to publish them online; Eva Hoffe, who had possession of the papers and sold some for millions of dollars, plans to appeal decision.

byline.original: By JODI RUDOREN and MYRA NOVECK

lead_paragraph: An Israeli judge ruled that a huge trove of documents written by Franz Kafka and his friend Max Brod must be turned over to Israel’s national library, which plans to publish them online.

headline.main: Woman Must Relinquish Kafka Papers, Judge Says
headline.print_headline: Woman Must Relinquish Kafka Papers, Judge Says
